---
title: "Training elsewhere"
---

Apart from the training the UQ Library offers, here are other providers, at UQ and elsewhere.

## Data Science CRP

The [Data Science Collaborative Research Platform](https://research-support.uq.edu.au/resources-and-support/facilities-and-infrastructure/data-science-collaborative-research-platform) (Data Science CRP) provide support and training on topics like bioinformatics, statistics, biometry and applied AI.

## Graduate School CDF

The [Graduate School Career Development Framework](https://cdf.graduate-school.uq.edu.au/events/research-skills) (Graduate School CDF) lists various workshop directed at HDR students, including training offered by the Data Science CRP and the Institute for Social Science Research (ISSR).

## CBCS

The Centre for Biodiversity and Conservation Science hosts [seminars and workshops](https://cbcs.centre.uq.edu.au/events), notably the [R Workshops @ UQ](https://cbcs.centre.uq.edu.au/events-and-seminars/r-workshops-uq) series.

## The Carpentries

[The Carpentries](https://carpentries.org/) is a non-profit organisation offering workshops to learn foundation coding and data science skills to researchers. See [upcoming workshops](https://carpentries.org/workshops/upcoming-workshops/).
